item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 is Giving Players a Good Reason to Play the Campaign
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Call of Duty: Black Ops 6's campaign offers free rewards that players can use in Multiplayer and Zombies.
  • These rewards can be obtained by progressing the story, upgrading the Black Ops Safehouse, and completing Calling Card Challenges.

Activision is taking the initiative to encourage fans to play Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 's campaign by offering free rewards for progressing through the story, which can be used across the game's Multiplayer and Zombies modes. The single-player mode in the past few installments of the franchise has drawn a lot of flak from the community for being subpar, but it seems like the developers are going the extra mile to improve Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 's campaign.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 is less than a month away, and Activision has been actively releasing new details about the game to build up hype. Recently, the developers listed a plethora of changes they are making to Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 's multiplayer based on player feedback. Now, a new reveal sheds some light on the single-player aspect.

In a new blog post, Activision reveals some interesting details about Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 's campaign. The blog is the first of a two-part series that provides players with a thorough overview of what to expect from the campaign. One of the interesting details highlighted is that players will earn rewards in the Campaign that can be used for both Multiplayer and Zombies. The specific rewards aren't mentioned, but the blog states that players can obtain them by progressing through the story, upgrading their Black Ops Safehouse, and completing Calling Card Challenges.

Call of Duty Black Ops 6 Campaign Story Intel Leaves Ambiguity Around Mason's Future

The rewards are not the only interesting aspect of the blog, as it has sparked fresh speculation in the community regarding Alex Mason's future. Call of Duty: Black Ops 2 has multiple endings based on the choices players make. Depending on the decisions taken during the game, Alex Mason either survives or dies in Call of Duty: Black Ops 2 . This has left a lot of ambiguity around his future in the franchise. In the Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 story video, fans were quick to note that the developers used the cutscene in which Woods shoots Mason in the legs, as the headshot wound is missing. This has led many fans to believe that Mason might return in Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 .

While this might raise the hopes of all Mason fans, the likelihood of him appearing in Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 remains quite low. This is because the developers had previously stated that Mason is indeed dead in Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 . However, some fans also noted that since the tagline of Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 is "The Truth Lies," not everything the developers say should be taken at face value. Whatever the case is, it is less likely that such a significant part of the lore will be revealed anytime before the release of the game.

item.title: Hell is Us Should Follow in Elden Ring, Ghost of Tsushima’s Footsteps with One Feature
item.description:
Rogue Factor's upcoming action-adventure game Hell is Us , first announced back in 2022, was the subject of a substantial gameplay reveal during the most recent State of Play. This gameplay trailer gave audiences a good look at Hell is Us ' Soulslike-adjacent gameplay and unique world, which sets the stage for a promising, memorable gaming experience, albeit one that still has a bit to prove.

Among Hell is Us ' most intriguing elements is its approach to exploration and non-linear gameplay. The game will apparently feature semi-open-world elements, as players will be tasked with exploring various biomes and completing side activities in addition to the core objectives of the single-player story. According to the game's Steam page, there will be no map markers, compasses, or similar hand-holding features available to players as they make their way through this semi-open-world, similar to other Soulslike and exploration-centric games of the past few years, which have stripped away these staples as a response to the box-ticking nature of so many AAA adventure titles. Learning from the likes of Elden Ring and Ghost of Tsushima could help Hell is Us strike a good balance between engaging and accessible with its exploration.

How Hell Is Us Can Find a Happy Exploration Medium

Ghost of Tsushima and Elden Ring Offer Good Open-World Compromises

On its face, a massive open-world game like Elden Ring may not seem too different from the likes of Far Cry , Assassin's Creed , or any other AAA franchise that is criticized for having big, boring maps to explore: it's full of copy-paste content, including repeated bosses and building archetypes like dungeons, and it uses rewards like gear to incentivize long-term discovery. However, it sets itself apart from the competition in a number of key ways, not the least of which being its stripping away of much-maligned features like waypoints and quest markers, which in turn makes exploration feel more organic and less like a rote task or chore. Ghost of Tsushima is similarly stripped-back, though still more aligned with AAA gaming conventions in general.

But both games have some concessions when it comes to organic exploration. Ghost of Tsushima 's iconic guiding wind feature, which allows players to follow the direction that the wind blows in-game, is an example of this, but the game includes other immersive exploration aids as well, like birds and foxes that can be followed to points of interest. Fundamentally, these are the same as waypoints or map markers, but their unobtrusive nature makes them more engaging and a more seamless match for the sandbox.

Elden Ring 's Guidance of Grace serves a similar purpose. These wisps of light will point players in the direction of the next main story event, helping them stay on track without totally eliminating the sense of mystery that comes with exploring an unknown open world. Much like Ghost of Tsushima 's exploration tools, Guidance of Grace serves to give players a helping hand while keeping exploration organic, immersive, and, most importantly, in the hands of the player.

These Features Could Help Hell is Us, But Only If They Support a Strong Open World

It should go without saying that none of the aforementioned features, clever though they may be, are what make exploration in Ghost of Tsushima or Elden Ring so rewarding. Rather, they buttress open-world design that is already compelling. Maybe Hell is Us could adapt some of these features, using some in-world element to subtly guide players to their objectives, but interest-driven exploration would still need to be the priority. If Hell is Us can stick the landing with its uncanny and unsettling environment design, on a scale that lends itself to getting lost and forgiving detours, then it will have a good shot at delivering on its promise of "handhold-free" exploration while still being approachable and consistently enjoyable.

item.title: Sega Could Get the Lion’s Share of the Fighting Game Genre if Rumors Are True
item.description:
The original Virtua Fighter was a pioneer in the fighting game genre. Developed by Sega AM2 and released exclusively for arcades in 1993, the title gained notoriety not only because of its intuitive gameplay, but also its visuals, which were considered realistic at the time. Virtua Fighter may look rudimentary and basic by today's standards, but back then, it was revolutionary. Sega's renowned fighting game was the first in its genre to feature fully 3D polygonal graphics. This aspect of Virtua Fighter was a major selling point, and ultimately contributed to the game becoming a worldwide phenomenon in the 90s.

Virtua Fighter has spawned multiple sequels and spin-offs over the years, from 1994's Virtua Fighter 2 all the way up to 2014's Virtua Fighter: Fever Combo . Unfortunately, though, other than a few ports and enhanced re-releases, the VF franchise has been dormant for quite some time. Recent rumors seem to suggest, however, that this may not be the case for long. The prominent insider Midori, also known as RyanFromTheBronx, alleged earlier this year that Sega was working on a new mainline entry in the VF series, presumably titled Virtua Fighter 6 . This report, coupled with a recent tweet from Sega that fans believe was teasing VF 6 , has led speculation to run rampant about this unannounced game. If Sega is indeed working on this title, then the company's revival of Virtua Fighter could prove to be a bigger deal than some might expect.

A Virtua Fighter Revival Could Prove to be Very Successful

Evidence Suggests that Virtua Fighter 6 May Be in the Works

Rumors and teases aside, there are reasons to think that a new Virtua Fighter game is in development. Back in December 2023, Sega announced a new initiative to resurrect some of its legacy IPs. Among the franchises the publisher revealed would receive this reboot treatment were Jet Set Radio , Crazy Taxi, Streets of Rage , Shinobi , and Golden Axe . While it didn't provide any specific details about the new installments in these dormant properties, such as their names or release dates, the firm did hint that even more classic Sega IPs would be brought back in the future, in addition to the aforementioned five.

It's anyone's guess as to what other franchises the company will decide to revive, but based off of recent comments from Sega COO Shuji Itsumi, one of them may end up being Virtua Fighter . Shortly after Sega unveiled its plans for dormant series revivals in December, Itsumi revealed in an interview with the Washington Post that the Japanese publisher was actively entertaining the idea of making a new VF game. Taking all this into account, it seems like the chances of Virtua Fighter 6 happening are higher than ever before, which is especially great considering the renaissance the fighting game genre has been having as of late.

Sega Could Capitalize on the Fighting Game Boom With a New Virtua Fighter Game

Fighting games are becoming more and more popular throughout the years. Two of the biggest franchises in the genre, Street Fighter and Tekken , have been on a roll lately . Street Fighter 6 , which released last year, was met with rave reviews and broad commercial success. Tekken 8 , meanwhile, debuted in 2024 to near-universal acclaim from critics, selling over two million copies just one month after its launch. If Sega does make a new, high-quality Virtual Fighter game, it could end up standing toe-to-toe with these giants and potentially eclipsing them in one regard: approachability.

Virtua Fighter 6 Could Use Approachability to Its Advantage

If there's one thing Virtua Fighter is known for besides 3D graphics, it's having an accessible learning curve. So many fighting games are hard to get into due to their complex gameplay mechanics, but in VF 's case, that isn't an issue. The control schemes in most Virtual Fighter games are quite simple and easy to understand since general combat maneuvers typically only involve the use of three buttons and an 8-directional control stick. If a new Virtua Fighter game doubles down on this approachable gameplay philosophy that previous entries in the franchise had, it may appeal to a broader-than-usual audience, which could lead to it becoming one of Sega's next big hits.

item.title: Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero Players Are Getting Wrecked by the Great Ape Vegeta Fight
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Great Ape Vegeta in Dragon Ball: Sparking! ZERO is proving to be a serious challenge for some early-access players.
  • Players are expressing frustration on social media regarding the difficulty of the fight.
  • Some fans have found ways to cheese the fight without lowering the difficulty setting.

Only one day after Dragon Ball: Sparking! ZERO opened its early access period for Deluxe and Ultimate Edition owners, many players are already hitting a brick wall in the form of Great Ape Vegeta. As one of the earliest fights in the game's story mode, most wouldn't expect the climactic showdown between Goku and Vegeta to pose too much of a challenge. Unfortunately, the Prince of All Saiyans' Great Ape form has always been one of the most difficult fights of the Sparking! games, and this proves to be no exception in Dragon Ball: Sparking! ZERO .

For context, the Great Ape Vegeta fight was already notorious among the Sparking! fanbase before Sparking! ZERO 's release. Even back when the series was still known as the Dragon Ball: Budokai Tenkaichi games in the West, players were already having a hard time clearing the final chapter of the Saiyan Saga primarily because of the transformed Vegeta. Newcomers yet to familiarize themselves with Sparking! ZERO 's mechanics are finding it a major struggle to defeat the transformed version of the Saiyan Prince.

Many of these players understandably flocked to social media to share their frustrations. On Twitter, users are expressing their gripes about the fight's difficulty, giving varying reasons as to why they believed Vegeta's Great Ape form posed such a challenge. Many attribute the fight's unfairness to the high damage of Vegeta's ki blasts and how often he is able to use special attacks that can wipe out a player's health bar. Others also pointed out his painful grabs, which, combined with his super armor, means that fighting at close range with the Great Ape is equally hazardous.

Dragon Ball: Sparking! ZERO Players are Frustrated with Great Ape Vegeta

However, there have also been players who revealed they had found ways to cheese the fight without outright lowering the difficulty setting. Several users shared clips showing them spamming ki blasts at range, which was admittedly an often-used strategy in previous Dragon Ball video game titles for giant enemies. Some players also figured out how to keep Great Ape Vegeta in a stun-locked state with the use of the new Sparking! Mode mechanic, wherein they would enter Sparking! mode, rush in with a flurry of attacks, then back off to wait for their gauge to recharge and repeat the cycle.

Despite some frustrating fights, Dragon Ball: Sparking! ZERO is still being lauded by newcomers and veterans of the series alike. Early reviews for the title have praised it not only for its fast and satisfying gameplay but its faithful reimagining of the original anime and manga series. For fans of the IP, Dragon Ball: Sparking! ZERO is likely going to be one of the best video game spinoffs to come out this year.

item.title: Destiny 2 Weekly Reset: New Nightfall, Challenges, and Rewards
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Weekly Nightfall and Modifiers
  • Episode: Revenant Challenges
  • Exotic Mission Rotation
  • Raid and Dungeon Rotation
  • Raid Challenges
  • Ritual Activities: Crucible and Gambit
  • Legacy Activities and Challenges
  • Dares of Eternity Rotation
  • Xur Details
  • Trials of Osiris Map and Weekly Adept Weapon

Updated October 8, 2024: Another week has come for Destiny 2 , which means missions, challenges, and rewards have been reset. After plenty of waiting, the next Episode of Destiny 2 has finally arrived. As players have seen, Revenant adds a whole new story to pursue with the scorn leader Fikrul having resurfaced after obtaining an Echo. With this new power, Fikrul is raising an undead scorn army at the expense of the Elkisni, so the player teams up with Mithrax and Eido once again to put an end to this new threat.

Alongside the new story content, Episode: Revenant also sees plenty of changes coming to the game. As expected, Bungie is tweaking the gameplay sandbox with some major adjustments to Destiny 2 exotic weapons, buffing roaming supers, as well as finally allowing Titan players to really embrace that tank role with some interesting buffs. The popular Onslaught mode is also seeing some new content, which should push players to jump back into that playlist.

As expected, the Destiny 2 weekly reset is also here, bringing with it the usual refreshed content, activities, and rewards for players to chase over the next week. For a complete look at all the new content available for the week of October 8, including Nightfalls, Crucible modes, and challenges, here is everything players need to know.

Weekly Nightfall and Modifiers

Nightfall Strike : The Lightblade

Advanced Modifiers:

  • Champions : Unstoppable and Barrier
  • Hero Modifiers: Extra Shields. Solar and Arc.
  • Galvanized : Combatants have more health and are more difficult to stun.
  • Overcharge : Grenade Launcher and Kinetic Weapons when the player's subclass matches an active Surge element.
  • Threat : Arc
  • Surge : Arc and Stasis

Expert Modifiers:

  • All previous modifiers.
  • Equipment Locked : Unable to change equipment once the mission starts.
  • Randomized Banes : Combatants are granted random Banes.

Master Modifiers:

  • All previous modifiers.
  • Counterfeit : When defeated, combatants can drop explosives disguised as familiar items.
  • Master Modifiers : Locked Loadout, Extra Champions, and Extra Shields.

_______________________________________________________________

  • Nightfall Weapon : Undercurrent (Adept Grenade Launcher)

Episode: Revenant Challenges

Week 1

  • Coming Soon!

Exotic Mission Rotation

Bungie brought back various exotic missions for players to run through to earn new rewards, gear, as well as craftable versions of exotic weapons. Like the Raid and Dungeon rotator, this one changes on a weekly basis.

Featured Exotic Mission : Starcrossed (Wish-Keeper Exotic Combat Bow)

Raid and Dungeon Rotation

Originally introduced during Season 17, Bungie features Raids and Dungeons in a weekly rotation to make them farmable with updated rewards. Starting in Episode: Revenant, Bungie is making 2 of each available from the rotator each week:

  • Featured Raid : Last Wish and Vow of the Disciple
  • Featured Dungeon : The Shattered Throne and Duality

Raid Challenges

  • Salvation's Edge : Scenic Route
  • Deep Stone Crypt : The Core Four
  • Vow of the Disciple : Swift Destruction, Base Information, Defenses Down, Looping Catalyst
  • Vault of Glass : Strangers in Time
  • King's Fall : Gaze Amaze
  • Root of Nightmares : Illuminated Torment
  • Garden of Salvation : A Link to the Chain
  • Last Wish : Which Witch, Summoning Ritual, Keep Out, Forever Fight, Strength of Memory

Ritual Activities: Crucible and Gambit

Players can earn additional rewards through Destiny 2 's Pathfinder system simply by playing and performing certain tasks in ritual activities like Vanguard Strikes, Crucible, and Gambit.

  • Weekly Crucible Modes : Supremacy, Control, Elimination, Rumble
  • Gambit

Legacy Activities and Challenges

Europa

  • Exo Challenge : Simulation: Safeguard
  • Eclipsed Zone : Cadmus Ridge
  • Empire Hunt : Praksis: The Technocrat

Neomuna

  • Incursion Zone : Liming Harbor
  • Campaign Mission : Desperate Measures
  • Partition: Hard Reset

Throne World

  • Weekly Story Mission : The Ritual
  • Altars of Reflection : Weekly activity that players can take on through specifically marked icons within the Throne World. These missions typically involve light puzzle solving as well as battling enemy combatants.

The Moon

  • Trove Guardian: The Hellmouth
  • Wandering Nightmare: Nightmare of Jaxx, Claw of Xivu Arath (Hellmouth)
  • Campaign : In The Deep

Nightmare Rotation:

  • Fanatic (Insanity)
  • Omnigul (Anguish)
  • Skolas (Pride)

Dreaming City

  • The Dreaming City Curse Level : High - The Dark Monastery mission
  • Petra Venj Location : Rheasilvia
  • The Blind Well : Taken enemies - Plague: Inomina
  • Ascendant Challenge : Ouroborea (Aphelion's Rest in The Strand)

Dares of Eternity Rotation

  • Round 1 : Hive
  • Round 2 : Fallen
  • Final Round : Valus Ta'aurc

Xur Details

Xur, the exotic merchant of Destiny 2 , arrives every weekend until reset, giving players a short window to check out what he has in stock. With The Final Shape, Xur has seen a rework of what is on offer. Here's what the merchant has for the weekend of 10/4:

  • Chromatic Fire (Warlock chest armor)
  • Fr0st-EE5 (Hunter leg armor)
  • An Insurmountable Skullfort (Titan helmet)
  • The Huckleberry (Submachine Gun)
  • Graviton Lance (Pulse Rifle)
  • The Prospector (Grenade Launcher)
  • Hawkmoon (Hand Cannon)
  • Prospector Catalyst
  • Traveler's Chosen Catalyst
  • Exotic Cipher
  • Exotic Engram
  • Ascendant Shard
  • Glimmer
  • Nightfall Cipher (Adept)
  • Enhancement Core
  • Strange Gift (Random Item for 1 Strange Coin)
  • Friction Fire (Kinetic Submachine Gun)
  • Enigma's Draw (Kinetic Sidearm)
  • Seventh Seraph CQC-12 (Energy Shotgun)
  • Tarnished Mettle (Energy Scout Rifle)
  • Steel Sybil Z-14 (Heavy Sword)
  • Berenger's Memory (Heavy Grenade Laucher)
  • Crown-Splitter/Quickfang/Eternity's Edge (Heavy Sword)
  • Strange Weapon Engram
  • Holdfast Armor Set
  • Hinterland Cowl/Biosphere Explorer Helm/Ossuary Cover

Make sure to check back every Friday for a comprehensive breakdown of all the new exotic gear and rolls that Xur brings to Destiny 2 .

Trials of Osiris Map and Weekly Adept Weapon

Saint-14 and the Trails of Osiris offer players a high-end PvP activity in exchange for powerful rewards, especially for players who go flawless and earn a trip to the Lighthouse. Similar to most vendors in Destiny 2 , Saint-14 has a reputation system that rewards players for ranking up through playing and completing bounties.

Trials of Osiris for 10/4:

  • Map : Rotating: Mutliplex, Bannerfall, and Distant Shore
  • Weapon : Eye of Sol (Adept Legendary Sniper Rifle)
